11.93.text:
At a time when our businesses
have created 9.2 million new

15.57.text:
jobs in just over four years,
and more companies are

18.70.text:
considering bringing
jobs back from overseas,

21.03.text: we have a choice to make.

23.33.text:
We can make it easier for
businesses to invest in America

26.90.text: - or we can make it harder.

29.00.text:
I want to work with
Congress to create jobs

33.30.text:
But where Congress
won't act, I will.

35.73.text:
And I want to talk about three
things we're doing right now.

39.53.text:
First, we're helping more
businesses bring jobs

44.80.text:
Three years ago, my
Administration created SelectUSA

48.50.text:
- a team of people in embassies
abroad and agencies here

51.97.text:
at home focused on insourcing
instead of outsourcing.

55.83.text:
Today, they're helping a Belgian
company create jobs in Oklahoma.

60.10.text:
They're helping a Canadian
company create jobs in Kansas.

63.27.text:
In my State of
the Union Address,

64.60.text:
I asked more businesses
to do their part.

67.30.text:
And this week, business leaders
from across the country are

70.00.text:
coming here to the White House
to discuss new investments

72.93.text: that will create even more jobs.

76.60.text:
Second, on Thursday, I'll
be heading to Cooperstown,

79.47.text:
New York - home of the
Baseball Hall of Fame -

84.60.text:
Because believe it or not,
tourism is an export.

87.43.text:
And if we make it easier for
more foreign visitors to visit

90.40.text:
and spend money at America's
attractions and unparalleled

93.50.text:
national parks, that helps
local businesses and grows

98.97.text:
Finally, we know that investing
in first-class infrastructure

104.83.text:
And I want to spend
a minute on this,

106.10.text:
because it's very
important this year.

108.20.text:
We know business owners don't
seek out crumbling roads

111.13.text:
and bridges and
backed-up supply chains.

113.60.text:
They set up shop
where the newest,

119.63.text:
let them invent and sell
goods Made in America

121.83.text:
to the rest of the world
as fast as possible.

124.47.text:
Here's the problem: If
Congress doesn't act

127.43.text:
by the end of this
summer, federal funding

129.93.text:
for transportation
projects will run out.

132.97.text:
States might have to put some
of their projects on hold.

135.97.text:
In fact, some already are,
because they're worried

138.40.text:
Congress won't clear
up its own gridlock.

141.43.text:
And if Congress fails
to act, nearly 700,000

144.83.text:
jobs would be at
risk over the next year.

148.57.text:
That's why I put forward
a plan to rebuild our

150.53.text:
transportation infrastructure
in a more responsible way.

154.47.text:
It would support millions
of jobs across the country.

157.37.text:
And we'd pay for it without
adding to the deficit by closing

160.83.text:
wasteful tax loopholes
for companies that ship

165.43.text:
Now, the Republicans in
Congress seem to have

169.43.text:
Not only have they neglected
to prevent this funding from

172.03.text:
running out, their proposal
would actually cut by 80%

176.27.text:
a job-creating grant program
that has funded high-priority

183.40.text:
And they can't say
it's to save money,

185.27.text:
because at the very same time,
they voted for trillions

187.97.text:
of dollars in new tax cuts,
weighted towards those

195.23.text:
Instead of putting people to
work on projects that would grow

197.60.text:
the economy for everyone, they
voted to give a huge tax cut

201.10.text:
to households making more
than $1 million a year.

205.33.text:
So while Congress decides
what it's going to do,

207.77.text:
I'll keep doing what
I can on my own.

209.87.text:
On Wednesday, I was in New York
where workers are building

212.60.text:
the area's first large new
bridge in 50 years.

215.70.text:
And they're doing it
ahead of schedule.

218.10.text:
Three years ago, I took action
without Congress to fast-track

221.17.text:
the permitting process
for major projects.

223.47.text:
Normally, it would have
taken three to five years

228.30.text: We did it in a year and a half.

230.50.text:
And I announced a new plan to
cut red tape and speed up the

233.50.text:
process for even more
projects across the country.

237.40.text:
All these steps will make
it easier for businesses

239.70.text:
to invest in America and create
more good jobs.

243.47.text:
All of them can be
done without Congress.

245.60.text:
But we could do a lot more if
Congress was willing to help.

250.03.text:
In the meantime, I'll do
whatever I can - not just

252.27.text:
to make America a better
place to do business,

254.63.text:
but to make sure
hard work pays off,

257.40.text: and opportunity is open to all.

259.50.text:
Thanks, and have
a great weekend.
